channel.title: USPTO Other Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Other events.

item.title: World Intellectual Property Day 2022
Intellectual property (IP) workshop for K-12 educators
K-12 IP education office hours
PTAB Inventor Hour - Episode 7 - April 28
item.description: Do you want to learn more about the new Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) Pro Bono Program?

item.title: PTAB LEAP: Preparing for your AIA argument
item.description: Join the Patent Trial and Appeal Board's (PTAB) Legal Experience and Advancement Program (LEAP) to learn about oral arguments before the PTAB in America Invents Act (AIA) trials. The webinar will take place on Friday, May 6, from noon - 1 p.m. ET.

item.title: Agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent from Europe, you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, held from May 10-13, 2022.

item.title: USPTO Trade Secrets Symposium 2022: Trending cross-border issues
Agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent from Europe, you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, held from May 10-13, 2022.

item.title: Agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent from Europe, you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, held from May 10-13, 2022.

item.title: USPTO Trade Secrets Symposium 2022: Trending cross-border issues
What you need to sell your arts and crafts online: Building your identity, for Native American visual artists and craftspeople
PTAB LEAP: AIA mock oral argument practicum
item.description: Join the Patent Trial and Appeal Board's (PTAB) Legal Experience and Advancement Program (LEAP) for an America Invents Act (AIA) mock oral argument practicum. The event will take place Friday, May 13, from 1-4 p.m. ET.

item.title: Agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent from Europe, you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, held from May 10-13, 2022.

item.title: Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander Innovation and Entrepreneurship 2022, part one: Find pathways to breakthroughs
item.description: You have ideas, drive, and a vision of success, but what steps will you take to make that vision a reality? Learn to map your way forward from successful innovators who will share hard-earned tips from their own journeys. Register for part one of this free, online event series.

item.title: Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander Innovation and Entrepreneurship 2022, part two: Innovating for real-world solutions
item.description: Do you see a problem that you know you can fix? Do you want to improve the world with your creativity and drive? Learn from successful innovators how they approach, understand, and solve challenges, and how intellectual property protection has been key to their success. Register for part two of this free, online event series.

item.title: PTAB LEAP: AIA oral argument encore
item.description: Join the Patent Trial and Appeal Board's (PTAB) Legal Experience and Advancement Program (LEAP) for an America Invents Act (AIA) oral argument encore on Friday, May 20, from noon to 1 p.m. ET.

item.title: Intellectual property (IP) workshop for K-12 educators
K-12 IP education office hours
Proud Innovation 2022, part one: From ideas to innovations
item.description: Do you have an idea you want to bring to life? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to get inspired by successful innovators turning concepts into creations. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part one: From ideas to innovations.

item.title: Proud Innovation 2022, part two: From enthusiasm to entrepreneurship
item.description: Are you passionate about taking your special idea to the market? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to learn how to commercialize your innovation. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part two: From enthusiasm to entrepreneurship.

item.title: Intellectual property (IP) workshop for K-12 educators
K-12 IP education office hours
K-12 IP education office hours
Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.
